page.title: 08Riding Stables-Or Not?
page.content: To the north-east of Dinas Powys is a farm called "Mill Farm", but on our ordnance survey maps it is shown as riding stables. In previous years the local council was opposed to using the land for farming. The first owner allowed disabled people to meet here for activities such as riding, hence the misleading name "Riding Stables". At present Mr Idwal Symonds, the farmer, is the third owner. He breeds Shire horses which he frequently shows at agricultural events around the country. Along with this interest he breeds Welsh Black cattle and Cheviot sheep. Today the stables are located near St.Andrews Major, approximately three miles south-west of Mill Farm.
